item.title: Day-One Horror Survival Game Shadow Dropped for Xbox Game Pass
item.description:
Survival horror game Pacific Drive has surprisingly come to Xbox Series X/S and Xbox on PC, with the base game available on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate , Game Pass Premium, and PC Game Pass. The game arrives alongside its new paid DLC, the Whispers in the Woods expansion. While the launch of Whispers in the Woods came without warning across all available platforms, the unexpected porting of Pacific Drive to Xbox Series X|S and its instant inclusion on the Game Pass subscription service are a special pre-Halloween treat for subscribers.

First launched in February 2024 for PlayStation 5 and PC, the survival horror game developed by Ironwood Studios came with an unconventional approach to gameplay that has earned it some high respect among horror fans. Pacific Drive 's sales topped one million units sold within its first year of availability on its launch platforms, and its quality of gameplay earned it a nomination for Best Debut Indie Game at The Game Awards in 2024.

Now, Pacific Drive 's unique survival horror experience is available for the first time on Xbox, and the base game has been added as a shadow drop for Xbox Game Pass Ultimate, Game Pass Premium, and PC Game Pass. This expands the list of day-one Game Pass games for October 2025. Pitting the player against supernatural dangers while navigating through the fictitious Olympic Exclusion Zone of the Pacific Northwest region, their main sources of solace and protection are the station wagon that serves as their primary mode of transportation and the auto shop where they can more safely make repairs. Keeping the car in a good state of repair is essential, as explorable junctions start to collapse after too much time spent there, adding elements of suspenseful time management to an already harrowing journey.

The Whispers in the Woods expansion was first revealed via a trailer in September, but no exact release date was provided at that time. Now, it has arrived with the release of Pacific Drive 's version 1.11.0, and it is available to purchase across all platforms. Whispers in the Woods provides a new fully voiced storyline, a new map, and some additional gameplay features for Pacific Drive , including more types of anomalies and additional car parts, items, and cosmetics.

The unexpected inclusion on Xbox's signature game subscription service may help to win over some players that Microsoft has lost over the past few weeks. Following the new $30 monthly price for a Game Pass Ultimate subscription, which went into effect at the start of October, so many former fans rushed to unsubscribe that it reportedly crashed Game Pass's website. However, the price hike also arrived amid the addition of 48 new games, with many of them coming from Game Pass's new deal with Ubisoft+.

Pacific Drive Version 1.11.0 Patch Notes

  • Whispers in the Woods is now available!
    • A brand new storyline for Pacific Drive that adds new gameplay mechanics, a new map to explore, and a fully voiced narrative that exposes you to an anomaly-obsessed group of Zone fanatics.

  • Significant Performance Improvements to Pacific Drive
  • New Languages, new minor features, and new cosmetics
  • Additional bug fixes and UX improvements

Features and Content added to Base Game

  • Added new languages
    • Ukrainian
    • Italian

  • Updated Spawning Rules and Map improvements
    • Traffic Jam Obstruction
    • Dynamic Street Light Spawning for Paved and Dirt Roads

  • New color variations to find for decal kits-
    • Five new colors for Arda, Flames, Numbers, Panel, Sketchy, Stripes and Two Tone decals - bringing the total number to 32 new car cosmetics!

  • New garage cosmetics to discover and collect: Little library, Advanced Dartboard, Footprint, Hockey Sticks, Wheeled Shelves, Tennis, Steering wheel collage

Whispers in the Woods is Out Now!

  • Brand new linear Narrative storyline
  • Fully voice acted with new cast of characters
  • New Gameplay systems
  • New musical score by Wilbert Roget, II
  • New Anomalies and Anomaly Behaviors
  • New Items, Car Parts, and Cosmetics
  • Explore the Whispering Woods

Performance Improvements

A small foreword: This patch brings our largest effort, and in turn our most significant performance improvements to Pacific Drive to date. These improvements positively impact all versions of the game, including PC (high and low spec machines) and Consoles (both standard and performance mode). The changes target CPU, GPU, Video Memory, and Load times.

  • CPU
    • Disabled multiple unutilized aspects of Unreal Engine 4.27 that were not necessary for Pacific Drive
    • Reduced complexity of the physics scene for faster performance
    • Optimized expensive player specific physics overlaps
    • General improvements for blueprints by increasing use of cached data
    • Minor Time of Day optimizations
    • Multiple CPU specific hitches fixed

  • GPU
    • Massive reduction in base geometry and LODs for very expensive foliage and rock meshes
    • Improved culling of meshes at extreme distances
    • Improved LOD generation for the entire game. Notable areas of improvement
      • Car Parts and Upgrades
      • Items, Tools, and Resources
      • Garage Stations
      • Resource Providers and Scrapable Vehicles
      • Environment Detailing Meshes

    • Reduced dynamic distance field scene complexity
    • Reduced the default mirror shadow quality settings which were set higher than needed and could significantly impact performance

  • Video Memory
    • Removed redundant landscape grass data for improved memory footprint
    • Reduced some expensive distance field mesh resolutions for improved memory footprint
    • Reduced unused or underutilized texture sizes across the game with no visual impact

  • Load Times
    • Improved load times across the game with targeted procedural generation spawning optimizations

A Note on Shader Caching:

Alongside the improvements in performance, we are aware that there have been some regressions with shader caching with this update. However, overall performance has been largely improved over previous versions and we do have a fix for this specific issue that will be deployed in a near future patch.

Gameplay Balance and Scripting

  • Improved Resistance stacking for certain Car Parts
  • Adjustments to Lim Shield Effectiveness
    • The Lim Shield now has active battery drain while activated
      • 0.35 kW/sec. Battery Drain per Damage is reduced by 50% to help counteract this.

Developer Note: We found players were driving with the LIM Shield active at all times without much downside. To better align the car part with our design goals we added battery drain while it is active, but also lowered how much your battery drains when the shield mitigates damage.

  • Adjusted Expeditions Tutorials process
    • Tutorial timing flexibility for new players, you now have the ability to back out earlier if you don’t want to listen to Francis talk as much!

  • Weather pattern timing has been slowed, allowing them to last longer
  • Reduced death penalties on default settings:
    • 85% Chemicals lost on death
    • Car parts that die shortly before players dies are more likely to appear in the Friendly Dumpster
    • Car parts returned from Friendly Dumpster are more likely to return with better health ranges.
    • Car parts that die shortly before players die are less likely to appear on Remnant
    • These settings remain adjustable under Gameplay Settings if players prefer a different experience

  • Changed quirks that influence Battery Charge.
    • Battery now charges at 0.65 kW / Sec as opposed to 2 kW/Sec

Bugs and UX Improvements

  • Fixed occasional softlock conditions in Expeditions tutorial
  • Incorrect maps have been removed from the Expeditions map pool
    • Stabilizer maps have been removed from the Expeditions map pool, player can no longer spawn gateways by activating stabilizers on an Expeditions run

  • Fixed Red Balloons duplicating after resuming a suspended run on certain maps
  • Fixed occasional crashes on save/load
  • Fixed the rare occurrence of duplicating fuel cans
  • Fixed occasional softlock conditions in tutorial
  • Electric Engine now correctly display resource consumption rates
  • Repair Stop in Garage will now ignore peculiar parts
  • Improved HUD feedback on Thermal Vac and Magnet Bumper
    • Prevents Anchors from accidentally being put into Magnet Bumper inventory

  • Bridge points of interest now have less aggressive LOD (pop-in)
    • Switching from low detail to high detail bridge meshes happens further away

  • Fixed missing collision on two trees
  • Radio no longer lowers volume temporarily for dialogue when dialogue is fully muted in settings
  • Updated lighting visuals in red Zone storms
  • Fixed certain spawning issues for obstructions and buildings that sometimes block roads
  • Updated Pacific Drive Crash Reporter options and legal language to be Ironwood Studios specific

Known Issues for Base Game

  • Controller haptics still activate occasionally when disabled in settings
  • Status Effect indicators are not properly rotating in inventory
  • Z.E.T.I. System can get stuck in animation when saving/quitting during the animation
    • Small workaround - can be fixed by reinserting Z.E.T.I hard drive

  • A hitch can occur when destroying a Plasma Generator with the Impact Hammer
  • Abandoned cars sometimes spawn floating

Known Issues for Whispers in the Woods

  • Taking a standard Junction Exit after summoning an Attuned Gateway can cause Altars of Passage to not spawn in future Exit Junctions
  • The Refinery garage station will continue to run while the game is paused
  • Rare instances where Audio Tape dialogue is missing partial subtitles
  • Occasionally, certain new anomaly types will fail to spawn in their specially marked junctions
    • Applies to REDACTED Anomalies

  • REDACTED neck visuals can erratically stretch and distort in certain situations
  • REDACTED logbook Photo cannot be unlocked due to the nature of the Anomaly
  • A slight hitch can occur when any Attuned car part is highlighted

Platform Specific Issues for Whispers in the Woods

  • The Xbox Entitlement for the WITW DLC is tied to the connection status of Xbox Online Services
    • If a player has an existing Xbox save with the WITW DLC and goes offline, they get a warning that “this save is inaccessible due to missing content” message when trying to load the game. Save becomes accessible once connection is reestablished to the Xbox Online Services.

  • On PlayStation 5 Performance Mode and Xbox Series S consoles, depending on graphics settings, there is a problem that can cause fog to flicker under certain conditions
    • We’ve prepared a fix for this issue, and will be implementing it soon

8.5 /10

Pacific Drive

Followed

item.title: How to Unlock All Weapons in Ninja Gaiden 4
item.description:
Now that Ninja Gaiden 4 is in the hands of players, many will likely be looking to find out how it compares to previous games in the series. One of the key elements players will be wondering about is Yakumo's arsenal of weapons , and if he has access to a wide range of tools to destroy human and fiend enemies alike. While the weapons themselves provide an amazing amount of diversity in gameplay, NG4 's arsenal differs from recent Ninja Gaiden games. Players who experienced the Ninja Gaiden 2 Black remaster will probably expect an extended weapon collection. In this guide, we'll provide the complete list of all weapons in Ninja Gaiden 4 , and reveal when they will be unlocked for use.

All Weapons in Ninja Gaiden 4 (& How to Unlock Them)

Weapons in NG4, Explained:

Unlike recent entries in the Ninja Gaiden series, exploration plays no role in unlocking weapons in Ninja Gaiden 4. Players hoping to scour through each chapter, looking for that new weapon hanging on a wall, or placed at a shrine, will unfortunately be disappointed. However, the work Platinum Games has done on Yakumo's existing arsenal makes up for it in a major way.

In Ninja Gaiden 4, the weapons you unlock are built into key moments in the story. This means that you will gain new weapons only at key scripted moments. While some fans may think this will limit the combat possibilities in Ninja Gaiden 4, in reality, nothing could be further from the truth. While it's true that there are fewer weapons overall – Yakumo has access to five main weapons – the ability to switch between weapons instantly proves to be an incredible boon to the flow and overall feel of combat.

As you play through NG4, you'll discover that each weapon has unique strengths. Often, you will want to switch weapons multiple times in a single encounter, especially if you are going for the upper echelons of NG4 's grading system. Each weapon has its own unique list of skills, allowing you to custom tailor your builds based on your favorite weapons. Somehow, Platinum has made fewer weapon choices feel like a massive increase in combat options.

Yakumo's Weapon List:

Yakumo has access to five main weapons, each of which unlocks at specific story points. They are as follows:

  • Takeminakata – Twin Blade/Tachi: Unlocked at the start of the game. Yakumo's main weapon.
  • Yatousen – Rapier/Lance: The second weapon Yakumo unlocks. It is found holding the first Dark Dragon seal in place. You'll collect it at the end of Chapter 3, and gain access to it at the start of Chapter 4.
  • Magatsuhi – Staff/Hammer: The third addition to Yakumo's arsenal. Removed from the seal at the end of Chapter 7, available to use at the start of Chapter 8.
  • Kage-Hiruko – Assassin's Tools/Mechanical Arms: This will be the final addition to Yakumo's main arsenal, which are assigned to each button on the D-Pad. This will be removed from the seal at the end of Chapter 10, and available for use at the start of Chapter 11.
  • Dark Dragon Sword – Sword of Evil: This will be the true final weapon, but Yakumo will only have access to it in Chapter 19, Ninja Gaiden 4 's final chapter. You'll need to defeat a very important enemy early in the chapter to gain access to this weapon, which will take you through the end of the game.

Warning ! Story Spoiler Ahead!

Second Playable Character's Weapon:

Once you reach Chapter 14 in NG4, you'll stop playing as Yakumo, and start playing as Ryu Hayabusa through the end of Chapter 18. Ryu only has access to his trusty Dragon Sword. Fans of the series will know this katana well. Instead of alternate weapons being assigned to the D-Pad, Ryu will instead have his various Ninpo abilities .

This marks all the weapons currently available in Ninja Gaiden 4. Should any new weapons be added in subsequent DLC or updates, we will add them to this list immediately.

Ninja Gaiden 4
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
October 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB

item.title: What are Savior and Payback Kills in Battlefield 6?
item.description:
Battlefield 6 is definitely off to a strong start, with an excellent launch that has players hyped. With a ton of additional content arriving with Season 1, there’s probably no better time to dive into Battlefield 6 than right now. Of course, as new seasonal content rolls out, players may want to jump in and get a head start on their Assignments.

Assignments are a great way to earn free rewards while also unlocking some of the game’s best weapons. However, some of these challenges can be a bit tricky. For instance, players might be having trouble getting Savior and Payback Kills. This guide will help you do just that.

How to Get Savior Kills in Battlefield 6

Savior Kills are earned when players eliminate an enemy that is actively damaging their teammates or allies , effectively saving them from death. While players may rack up Savior Kills passively, the best way to farm them is by playing large-scale modes like Conquest, Rush, Breakthrough, and Escalation.

Since players are usually grouped in these modes, there are more opportunities to score Savior Kills. However, Squad Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, and Domination can also work well for those sticking close to their teammates.

Savior Kills are required for the first Protection Expert Unit Assignment , which tasks players with earning 30 of them to unlock the Polysteel Fireteam Vedmak Support Skin. They’re also needed for the Squad Deathmatch Challenge 2 under Unit Assignments, which specifically requires players to earn 30 Savior Kills in Squad Deathmatch. Completing this challenge rewards players with the Thorn Espada Support Skin.

How to Get Payback Kills in Battlefield 6

Payback Kills, or Payback Accolades, are a little different from Savior Kills. Instead of being earned by taking out enemies that have damaged your teammates, Payback Kills are earned by eliminating the last enemy that killed you. This can be done by getting taken out and then respawning or getting revived before killing that same player, or by somehow taking them out while you’re down, such as with mines or grenades.

Payback Kills are something players will naturally rack up over time. However, the best way to farm them quickly is by playing CQB modes like Team Deathmatch, Squad Deathmatch, and Domination. Since the maps in these modes are smaller, you’re much more likely to run into players who have already taken you out compared to larger-scale modes like Conquest.

Payback Kills are required for the first Protection Expert Unit Assignment Challenge , where players need to earn 10 of them along with 50 multi-kills. Completing this challenge rewards players with the Polysteel Fireteam Vedmak Engineer Skin, and the Grey Strike Coyote Squad Engineer Skin. Payback Kills may also be needed for other challenges, such as Daily and Weekly Challenges, for additional XP.

Battlefield 6
9 /10
22
8.6 /10
Released
October 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

item.title: Best Teams to Manage in Football Manager 26
item.description:
One of the most important decisions to make is what team to manage in Football Manager 26 , and with so many leagues and teams to consider, now including women's football, the choice has never been harder. This article will put forward teams from a range of countries and of varying levels, all of whom are interesting in their own way.

While some teams with storied histories need rebuilding, others have never enjoyed great heights and deserve their time in the spotlight. There are also clubs that find themselves in peculiar situations or stand out for one reason or another.

Truro City FC

Become The First Cornish Team To Reach The English Football League

  • League: National League (English 5th Tier)
  • Budget: £5K

Last season, Truro City FC won the National League South, becoming the first team from Cornwall to reach England's 5th tier of football, and players can attempt to take them even further. While keeping them up in the National League will be tough for the first year, players could make a playthrough with them even more interesting by trying to focus on Cornish players, or at least those from the South West.

Welsh players and those from Brittany in France might also be of interest due to cultural ties. Guiding Truro City FC to the higher leagues could also help football take over from Rugby as the biggest sport in Cornwall, and they could form a rivalry with Plymouth Argyle and Exeter City from the neighboring county of Devon.

Wrexham AFC Women

Win The League & Then Make The Welsh League A European Threat

  • League: Adran Premier (Welsh 1st Tier)
  • Budget: £20K

If players are looking for a fun women's team in Football Manager 26 , then Wrexham AFC Women could be a great shout. Unlike in the men's game, all the top Welsh sides compete in Wales, rather than in the English system. With Cardiff, Swansea, and now Wrexham in the Adran Premier, this competitive league is a fresh experience.

This will be Wrexham's third year in the top flight, and players could lead them to their first title. After that, the aim would be to make the Welsh league a threat in Europe, something that is far more realistic in the women's game than the men's. Players could also focus on developing Welsh talent, and when international management is added back into the game, take over the national team to lead Wales to glory.

Colon de Santa Fe

Recent Copa Sudamericana Finalists At The Bottom Of Argentina's 2nd Tier

  • League: Primera Nacional (Argentinian 2nd Tier)
  • Budget: 375K

After decades in the first tier of Argentinian football and even appearing in the Copa Sudamericana, Colon de Santa Fe now finds itself at the bottom of the second tier, with its prospects looking bleak.

For those unfamiliar with domestic football in Argentina, the unique league setup with two groups with half-year tournaments and plenty of interesting rules can make for a nice shakeup from traditional football leagues. There is also the chance to find incredible local talent, some of whom could go on to become huge global stars.

Brighton & Hove Albion

Continue The Moneyball & Modern Tactics, But Finally Take Brighton To The Top

  • League: Premier League (English 1st Tier)
  • Budget: £100M

For years, Brighton & Hove Albion have impressed all in the football world, both on and off the pitch. Tactically, modern managers such as Graham Potter, Roberto de Zerbi, and Fabian Hurzeler have brought unique setups and systems to the south coast, while the recruitment department finds bargain after bargain with a data-driven approach.

This makes Brighton the perfect club to test out all of FM 26's new features. With in and out of possession tactics, players have even more control and can go wild, perhaps recreating Hurzeler's tactics from when he was at FC St. Pauli. The transfer system has also changed, so players can test out new ways to Moneyball their way to success. The aim should also be to finally take Brighton into the top four, perhaps by keeping a few of their stars instead of selling them all to Chelsea.

AD Ceuta FC

A Spanish Team From The African Continent

  • League: La Liga 2 (Spanish 2nd Tier)
  • Budget: £0

At the tip of Morocco, opposite Gibraltar, there is a Spanish autonomous city called Ceuta. Despite being on the African continent, their team, AD Ceuta FC , plays in the Spanish football system, and recently made it to the 2nd tier.

This makes them an intriguing club to manage, especially when developing young talent and creating a unique identity. The aim could be to promote both Spanish and Moroccan players, and reaching La Liga to compete with giants such as Barcelona and Real Madrid would be a huge moment and truly put Ceuta on the map.

FC Girondins de Bordeaux

French Giants Rebuilding Their Entire Club In The 4th Tier

  • League: Championnat National 2 (French 4th Tier)

It's always sad to see a football club fall apart due to financial instability and other issues off the pitch. Up until recently, FC Girondins de Bordeaux were one of the biggest French sides, but a few rocky years meant they went into administration and were eventually forcibly relegated to the 4th tier, having to give up their professional status.

Taking over management of Bordeaux, therefore, means rebuilding everything from the ground up, and it will be many years before they can even think of competing for the French title, which they won as recently as 2009. Unfortunately, the 4th tier of French football is not in the base game, so players will need to use a database to play as Bordeaux.

Other Teams To Manage In Football Manager 26

  • Dagenham & Redbridge: Manage Andy Carroll in the 6th Tier of English football.
  • 1860 Munich: Former champions and Munich's other club, lingering in Germany's 3rd tier.
  • Oldham Athletic: A former Premier League club that suffered decades of relegation and misery, now back in the EFL.
  • Montpellier HSC: The 2012 French champions, currently in the 2nd tier.
  • Palermo FC: A big Italian club, yet to return to the top level after years of turmoil.
  • Retro Futebol Clube Brasil: Climb from the 3rd tier of Brazilian football with this new club, who have retro kits.
  • Manchester United: Always a good club to manage, given their failure to return to the days of Sir Alex.
  • RC Deportivo: Former Spanish champions and a huge club fallen to the 2nd tier.
  • Luton Town: Suffered a double relegation from the Premier League & Championship.
  • Notts County: An old club down in League Two.
  • FC Union Berlin Frauen: A growing women's club with huge support.
  • Tottenham Hotspur: Finished one place above the drop last season, way below their expectations.
  • Rangers: Scottish giants struggling to find form.
  • Falkirk: Earned a double promotion to the Scottish Premiership, where survival will be a huge success.
  • FC Andorra: An Andorran club in Spain's 2nd tier.
  • SC Telstar: After nearly 50 years in the Dutch 2nd tier, they finally made it back to the Eredivisie.
  • Grimsby Town: A popular League Two team after beating Man Utd in the cup.
  • Sheffield Wednesday: A club going through some dark days.
  • 1. FC Shweinfurt: Newly promoted to 3. Liga after two decades in the 4th and 5th tiers.
  • AFC Wimbledon: A fan-owned club with an endearing history.
  • Wrexham: Continue their historic climb, this time tackling the Championship.
  • Young Lions: Practically the Singapore U21 side, but a club.
  • C.D. Cobreloa: Start producing the best Chilean talent once again.
  • Chelsea Women: They have dominated domestically, but have yet to win the Champions League.
  • Clwb Cymric: The 'Welsh Bilbao', as they only sign Welsh speakers. However, a database is needed.
  • Exeter City FC: A fan-owned club in League One.
  • Gimcheon Sangmu FC: A South Korean team for players serving their military service.
  • The Spartans FC: Take this Edinburgh-based club from the 4th tier to the 1st tier of Scottish football.
  • Siracusa Calcio: Lead this Sicilian club to Serie A, perhaps with a focus on players from Sicily.
  • Durham Women's FC: Try to reach the Women's Super League.

Football Manager 26

Followed

item.title: Fallout 76 - Burning Springs Update Trailer
item.description: Fallout 76 previews its Burning Springs update, which takes players to the wasteland of Ohio with The Ghoul, voiced by Walter Goggins. Fallout 76's Burning Springs update launches on December 2, 2025.
